reviews.comment: Not sure why CPEN has to take this since our 221 overlaps this significantly. Excellent prof, lectures, course organization though. Very nice prof and generous marking scheme. Assessments very fair and responsive on Piazza.
Explains concepts super well and made this course a lot easier to understand. Makes lecture recordings so you can watch on 2x speed if you miss any. Tests are very fair.

Cinda wasn't super available for OH or individual help but she's a great lecturer. I had so much fun in her classes and can tell she's super passionate about her projects. Such an inspirational person and very fun to listen to!

Cinda is one of my favorite profs. Her lectures were super engaging and informative. She is super caring and helpful to all the students. The course itself is more self taught with assignments and quizzes which make up a massive chunk of the grade but isn't hard if you just put enough time for them. Overall great prof and wish she taught more.

If every computer science class at UBC was taught by Cinda, I wouldn't be trying to transfer away.

My favourite prof by far.
Pretty nice prof, super caring but sometimes not as organized. There are frequently errors in lecture content, but she (or the TA team) is quick to correct them.
super inspirational!! Genuinely cares about students, clear grading criteria, a lof of help available. Overall a great experience and a great course

This professor left much to be desired. She tends to treat students like children. Communicates unprofessionally (like a teen texting a friend, not a professor at a major university). Makes mistakes frequently.  Only positive I can really say is that she's not mean (but that's a low bar).

This course was too easy. Please make it harder. Can't believe the CPSC department is literally giving out free A+ grades smh.

Please make the course harder. Reduce the weights for examlets, labs, etc. Make the final 80%.

Class was pretty chill, super nice mark breakdowns with the weekly 5% tests rather than midterms, really helped me to keep up with the course. Cindeez was super nice and explained things fairly clearly although her slides are a bit messy and hard to understand if you look at them out of context. William was an L.

Cinda was super sweet and brought a lot of energy to lectures. Her teaching is clear and engaging, though it's sometimes hard to read what she's writing. The course is very generous with how assignments are weighted. 9 weekly examlets worth 5% each, 3 homework and 3 programming assignments each worth 4%, with a final worth 23%, and 8% on labs.

Her course is for children! topics are super easy but she makes a lot of mistakes and that causes confusion. Cinda: if you think that's true clap. :| 
Cinda: I'll draw a heart wherever it's a graph and I'll draw a star wherever it's a queue. :| 
Cinda: Remember 2 weeks ago I made a mistake? sorry if you messed up your exam because of that. :|

Professor Heeren *is* the best professor I have had at university so far. I did not know college courses could be this well designed. Her excitement for the subject shows. Each lecture is a pleasure to attend. Her energy, pacing, engagement with the class, care for the students' well-being- it's incredibly inspiring. She's genuinely a role model.
Cinda is great! I would recommend her to anyone and everyone, she is caring, easy to talk to, helpful, and clear.

I LOVE Cinda. She's a gem. So so so kind and understanding. She also radiates a very smart energy, like she knows what she's talking about in a very non-arrogant way (obv but I find it inspirational and it comes out in her teaching as she gets us to see different ways). I took CPSC 203 with her (but course option is not letting me select that)
Cinda is amazing. Super approachable, helpful and encouraging during office hours, and her lectures are engaging.

A fantastic professor. Her lectures are super interesting and I'm always so excited to show up and watch. Time flies when you're in her class because she schedules her lectures not as an information foie gras, but rather as a journey and you're discovering the algorithms and data structures with her as if buddies on a voyage. Tests are super fair.
Cinda is absolutely amazing. Lectures were interesting and easy to understand and she's also very active on piazza and discord. Btw she's a big fan of Taylor Swift haha.
She's an amazing prof. You can easily do well as long as you keep up with the material and practice problems.

Wonderful professor and just a very useful class in general. There were so many practice questions which made learning the material so fun and straightforward. So far my favourite CPSC course at UBC along with 210. I would strongly recommend Cinda for 221!

Honestly, I have never seen such a hilarious and lighthearted professor. Watching and attending her lectures was a joy. Cinda delivered difficult material in an interesting, effortless and caring way. This is the course that gave me negative burnout. Truly enjoyed Cinda's course and if I fail it (just took the final), I will be happy to retake it.

It seems this professor just comes to seek attention and brotherhood with the students. A show with slang words and pop-culture references is put out just to get on the same page with the students, but it impedes your learning, creates an impression of futility and uselessness of course when in reality it is THE most important course.
She is an amazing professor. She is extremely caring and concerned about student learning. Her expectations are clear and makes the class really interesting.

I LOVE Cinda. She is the best CPSC prof I had so far. She knows the material super well, and teaches in the most fun and engaging way. She also designed the online course well. Learning objects always clear, fair assessments and grade distributions, very responsive on Piazza, easy to follow, genuinely cares for students' success and wellbeing.
Cinda is a great professor, she explains concepts well and makes everyone feels so included.
She is AMAZING!!!
Reasonable grading scheme, listens to student feedback, and willing to adjust assignment deadlines if it makes sense.

Cinda literally saved me from having to push my entire degree back by a semester. I was doing SO bad in 121 and was failing and she spent so much time helping me and managed to get me to pass. She was so caring and so passionate and I owe it to her to finally be in 4th year and graduating soon. #TEAMCINDA<3

Cinda was an absolutely great prof. She is also a very nice person. I really enjoyed taking a class with her. I don't like takingcomputer courses, but she made this course very manageable and engaging. I highly recommened her.
Amazing teacher. Deeply cares for student learning and motivates students to do well in the course.

Cinda was a fantastic and prof and did her absolute best to provide quality education through the new online format. Her lectures were engaging and it made me want to attend live lectures instead of watching the recordings. She cares deeply for her students and is overall a very nice human!

This is my 4th CS course at UBC, and she is by far the best prof so far! I had some technical issues which I never mentioned but she contacted me out of the blue and offered to help, which was so sweet and far above. Her lectures, tests, assignments are fair and her OH accessible. 10/10. Lots of homework but that's just the nature of 221.

Overall a good instructor. Very good verbal and intuitive explanations, and engaging lectures. However, her in-class tablet use was clunky, partly because she constantly had to squish things in because the slides didn't give enough room for writing.

Cinda is just so caring and sweet :) Her lecture is super organized and her explanations are amazing. I took a course with her in the past, at that time she's a bit less organized and often can't finish all the material in time, but now she's completely completely changed. Super caring and her lecture's always evolving.
Cinda has a wonderfully upbeat attitude, and her lectures are thorough and easy to understand. If all you do is show up to class and pay attention, you will do fine on the exams.

She is a great professor. Her method of teaching made me interested in this course. She explains everything in the best way. The class is fun and you also learn a lot. She cares all the students. Would take another course with her

She is a very nice and caring person. However, I find her lecture to be not helpful towards my learning at all. She often times gets confused mid-lecture and cannot teach the material in a clear and concise way.

Unanswered emails. Disorganization. Late to class. Unreadable slides. Irrelevant stories/self depreciation jokes and then runs out of time to do the actual material. Gives impossible exams and then scales up... how is that an accurate measure of knowledge?

Many mistakes on her slides, and going to her lecture is just waste of time. Lots of irrelevant drama in class (e.g. spending 10 mins try to draw a perfect dot on the slide). She said she was an expert on teaching, but honestly her teaching style is for kindergartens. Spent way too much time joking, and very little time on the actual concepts.

Very friendly and sociable, doesn't take teaching seriously. Arrived late almost every lecture. Her slides contain many mistakes, which she often wont correct until the next lecture. Only ever shows back-of-the-napkin solutions to problems and expects students to use the internet to find better answers. Expect your first grades during week of exam.
One of the best :)

Very bad professor. Instead of giving serious lectures she makes jokes and pop culture references. Canceling programming assignments at the end of the term when students are most eager to learn. The grading scheme is very loose. Students can get many free marks by attending labs simply. If she teaches 320 next year you need to avoid her at all cost

CPSC 121 is known to be a hard course but when you take it with Cinda, you'll realize that she explains the concepts clearly. Although she confuses herself sometimes in the lecture, but that doesn't really matter. She could have been more specific on some topics though.
I struggled very much in this class, but that I blame on myself and not the prof. The prof was enthusiastic and very clear on all the concepts. She brought popcorn and timbits so thats a plus too.
She's a good teacher, bit unorganized and unclear at times but it makes no big impact to understanding. Very kind and friendly, and easy to listen to. Would recommend for sure.
Great teacher, lots of good examples, funny (at least she tries), sometimes takes too long to get the simple stuff across and then has to rush through the more complex stuff.

One of the most charismatic lecturers I have ever met, with the ability to somehow make a 2.5 hour lecture enjoyable. Although lectures were rushed at times, office hours really helped with clarifying more difficult concepts.

Professor Heeren is the best professor I ever had. I love the way she teaches and involves students in the class. Also, She created the group midterms which give the chance to know the pathway other students approach to solve the problems. She is great in teaching CS121 by relating the material to upper year courses (CS221). Overall. AWESOME.

Great lecturer who cares a lot about ensuring everyone's understanding of complex topics. She was on the class forum answering questions 24/7 all semester, and was very available and approaching in office hours. I found the workload and marking schemes for homework and exams to be very fair, and would definitely recommend taking a course with her.

One of the BEST CS prof I've ever had at UBC. She has an amazing and attractive character. Her lectures are very energetic and make me very comfortable. Exam and assignments are a lot more challenging than 210. Would definitely take her class again.

Cinda's a really great prof, probably one of the best cs-lecturers I've ever had. She's really enthusiastic and makes you seem less afraid about the material. However, her exams and programming assignments are EXTREMELY difficult. Compared to previous years, the PAs and exams were much much much much harder..
Shes very enthusiastic about the subject. Will highly recommend. Although exams are hard..
One of the nicest profs you'll ever meet. Can be slow during class sometimes as she answers everyone's questions. Final was made somewhat different from what we were taught in the syllabus.

This was her first semester teaching at UBC so there was some bumps along the way but overall, Cinda is a cheerful enthusiastic prof. She keeps the class engaged. Exams/assignments are tough but I think Wolfman has more control over these topics as both sections were sort of co-taught.

Cinda is awesome! Take her if you can. She explains algorithms super well and in a way that's easy to understand and remember. The course was a little disorganized, but I'm sure that'll get better as she teaches the course more

Cinda is a very welcome addition to UBC. Lectures are great and really help to develop intuition, exams are fair (and fun!), and her office hours are extremely helpful. Assignments/exams are creative and seem designed to test your understanding of the material rather than your ability to regurgitate information. Highly recommended.
